ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1 to do readings
1 Hour per week was spent on this course outside of class.
2-3 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: strengths: wonderful and informative guest lecturersweakness: it was a bit unclear in terms of what was required from the class at first.
Very stimulating. Good exposure to subject.
It is an interesting seminar course which covers a broad array of topics, and there are many guest speakers, most of which are very good.
Interesting class with a lot of wonderful guest lecturers.
Excellent course topics and all are applicable to my future in occupational medicine.

The course was a great introduction to occupational health and medicine. I really enjoyed having experts in the different fields coming into the class to speak. I also enjoyed the interactive class atmosphere it catered to an overall great learning experience.
I enjoyed the course because students were exposed to many different topics through the instructor and through the lecturers he brought into the classroom.
This is a nice intro to occupational medicine.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  instructor was very approachable and easy going. he was willing to help students with any inquiries.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Very professional. Engaging. Good use of guest speakers.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  He is a very effective lecturer and very likable guy.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Really great lecturer and was able to obtain other knowledgeable lecturers.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Dr Russi is an exemplary individual. His friendly disposition is remarkable. He is fine colleague one of Yale's finest.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Dr. Russi is a very knowledgeable professor with many years of experience in the field of occupational health at the hospital making his lectures more medical based.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Dr. Russi is a great professor who is genuinely interested in students' learning.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Dr. Russi is a great professor. He is supportive and motivational.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: i would recommend this class to students interested in environmental science.
Great course. Required but still excellent.

This is a seminar course with a different topic for every lecture, often with guest lecturers who specialize in this topic. The topics are related to occupational health, sometimes in surprising ways. The readings are useful for the classes, and generally short and interesting. Class was heavily populated by medical students/residents which influenced the discussions, usually in an interesting way.
Great class, really interesting overview of occupational medicine.
This class comes highly recommended for anyone who wants a valuable course in the field of Occupational Medicine.
The class was a great introduction to the world of occupational health and medicine. The class is ideal for students with a biological or medical background.
Yes, I would recommend it. It is important to know a bit about occupational med if you are in the field of public health.
